db:abstract.db:para: The QTextCodec class provides conversions between text encodings.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Qt uses Unicode to store, draw and manipulate strings. In many situations you may wish to deal with data that uses a different encoding. For example, most Japanese documents are still stored in Shift-JIS or ISO 2022-JP, while Russian users often have their documents in KOI8-R or Windows-1251.
Qt provides a set of QTextCodec classes to help with converting non-Unicode formats to and from Unicode. You can also create your own codec classes.
The supported encodings are:

db:listitem.db:para: Iscii-Bng, Dev, Gjr, Knd, Mlm, Ori, Pnj, Tlg, and Tml

db:section.db:para: If Qt is compiled with ICU support enabled, most codecs supported by ICU will also be available to the application.

Some care must be taken when trying to convert the data in chunks, for example, when receiving it over a network. In such cases it is possible that a multi-byte character will be split over two chunks. At best this might result in the loss of a character and at worst cause the entire conversion to fail.

The QTextDecoder object maintains state between chunks and therefore works correctly even if a multi-byte character is split between chunks.

db:section.db:title: Creating Your Own Codec Class
db:section.db:para: Support for new text encodings can be added to Qt by creating QTextCodec subclasses.

The pure virtual functions describe the encoder to the system and the coder is used as required in the different text file formats supported by QTextStream, and under X11, for the locale-specific character input and output.
To add support for another encoding to Qt, make a subclass of QTextCodec and implement the functions listed in the table below.

db:section.db:title: [protected] QTextCodec::QTextCodec()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QTextCodec, and gives it the highest precedence. The QTextCodec should always be constructed on the heap (i.e. with new). Qt takes ownership and will delete it when the application terminates.

db:section.db:title: [virtual noexcept protected] QTextCodec::~QTextCodec()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the QTextCodec. Note that you should not delete codecs yourself: once created they become Qt's responsibility.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QList<QByteArray> QTextCodec::aliases() const
db:section.db:para: Subclasses can return a number of aliases for the codec in question.
Standard aliases for codecs can be found in the IANA character-sets encoding file.

db:section.db:title: [static] QList<QByteArray> QTextCodec::availableCodecs()
db:section.db:para: Returns the list of all available codecs, by name. Call QTextCodec::codecForName() to obtain the QTextCodec for the name.
The list may contain many mentions of the same codec if the codec has aliases.

db:section.db:title: [static] QList<int> QTextCodec::availableMibs()
db:section.db:para: Returns the list of MIBs for all available codecs. Call QTextCodec::codecForMib() to obtain the QTextCodec for the MIB.

db:section.db:title: bool QTextCodec::canEncode(QChar ch) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the Unicode character ch can be fully encoded with this codec; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QTextCodec::canEncode(QStringView s) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns true if the Unicode string s can be fully encoded with this codec; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QTextCodec::canEncode(const QString &s) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
s contains the string being tested for encode-ability.

db:section.db:title: [static] QTextCodec *QTextCodec::codecForHtml(const QByteArray &ba, QTextCodec *defaultCodec)
db:section.db:para: Tries to detect the encoding of the provided snippet of HTML in the given byte array, ba, by checking the BOM (Byte Order Mark) and the content-type meta header and returns a QTextCodec instance that is capable of decoding the html to unicode. If the codec cannot be detected from the content provided, defaultCodec is returned.

db:section.db:title: [static] QTextCodec *QTextCodec::codecForHtml(const QByteArray &ba)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

Tries to detect the encoding of the provided snippet of HTML in the given byte array, ba, by checking the BOM (Byte Order Mark) and the content-type meta header and returns a QTextCodec instance that is capable of decoding the html to unicode. If the codec cannot be detected, this overload returns a Latin-1 QTextCodec.

db:section.db:title: [static] QTextCodec *QTextCodec::codecForLocale()
db:section.db:para: Returns a pointer to the codec most suitable for this locale.
The codec will be retrieved from ICU where that backend is in use, otherwise it may be obtained from an OS-specific API. In the latter case, the codec's name may be "System".

db:section.db:title: [static] QTextCodec *QTextCodec::codecForMib(int mib)
db:section.db:para: Returns the QTextCodec which matches the MIBenum mib.

db:section.db:title: [static] QTextCodec *QTextCodec::codecForName(const QByteArray &name)
db:section.db:para: Searches all installed QTextCodec objects and returns the one which best matches name; the match is case-insensitive. Returns nullptr if no codec matching the name name could be found.

db:section.db:title: [static] QTextCodec *QTextCodec::codecForName(const char *name)
db:section.db:para: Searches all installed QTextCodec objects and returns the one which best matches name; the match is case-insensitive. Returns nullptr if no codec matching the name name could be found.

db:section.db:title: [static] QTextCodec *QTextCodec::codecForUtfText(const QByteArray &ba, QTextCodec *defaultCodec)
db:section.db:para: Tries to detect the encoding of the provided snippet ba by using the BOM (Byte Order Mark) and returns a QTextCodec instance that is capable of decoding the text to unicode. This function can detect one of the following codecs:
If the codec cannot be detected from the content provided, defaultCodec is returned.

db:section.db:title: [static] QTextCodec *QTextCodec::codecForUtfText(const QByteArray &ba)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

Tries to detect the encoding of the provided snippet ba by using the BOM (Byte Order Mark) and returns a QTextCodec instance that is capable of decoding the text to unicode. This function can detect one of the following codecs:
If the codec cannot be detected from the content provided, this overload returns a Latin-1 QTextCodec.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual protected] QByteArray QTextCodec::convertFromUnicode(const QChar *input, int number, QTextCodec::ConverterState *state) const
db:section.db:para: QTextCodec subclasses must reimplement this function.
Converts the first number of characters from the input array from Unicode to the encoding of the subclass, and returns the result in a QByteArray.

state can be nullptr in which case the conversion is stateless and default conversion rules should be used. If state is not nullptr, the codec should save the state after the conversion in state, and adjust the remainingChars and invalidChars members of the struct.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual protected] QString QTextCodec::convertToUnicode(const char *chars, int len, QTextCodec::ConverterState *state) const
db:section.db:para: QTextCodec subclasses must reimplement this function.
Converts the first len characters of chars from the encoding of the subclass to Unicode, and returns the result in a QString.

state can be nullptr, in which case the conversion is stateless and default conversion rules should be used. If state is not nullptr, the codec should save the state after the conversion in state, and adjust the remainingChars and invalidChars members of the struct.

db:section.db:title: QByteArray QTextCodec::fromUnicode(const QString &str) const
db:section.db:para: Converts str from Unicode to the encoding of this codec, and returns the result in a QByteArray.

db:section.db:title: QByteArray QTextCodec::fromUnicode(const QChar *input, int number, QTextCodec::ConverterState *state = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Converts the first number of characters from the input array from Unicode to the encoding of this codec, and returns the result in a QByteArray.
The state of the convertor used is updated.

db:section.db:title: QByteArray QTextCodec::fromUnicode(QStringView str) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Converts str from Unicode to the encoding of this codec, and returns the result in a QByteArray.

db:section.db:title: QTextDecoder *QTextCodec::makeDecoder(QTextCodec::ConversionFlags flags = DefaultConversion) const
db:section.db:para: Creates a QTextDecoder with a specified flags to decode chunks of char * data to create chunks of Unicode data.
The caller is responsible for deleting the returned object.

db:section.db:title: QTextEncoder *QTextCodec::makeEncoder(QTextCodec::ConversionFlags flags = DefaultConversion) const
db:section.db:para: Creates a QTextEncoder with a specified flags to encode chunks of Unicode data as char * data.
The caller is responsible for deleting the returned object.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] int QTextCodec::mibEnum() const
db:section.db:para: Subclasses of QTextCodec must reimplement this function. It returns the MIBenum (see IANA character-sets encoding file for more information). It is important that each QTextCodec subclass returns the correct unique value for this function.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] QByteArray QTextCodec::name() const
db:section.db:para: QTextCodec subclasses must reimplement this function. It returns the name of the encoding supported by the subclass.
If the codec is registered as a character set in the IANA character-sets encoding file this method should return the preferred mime name for the codec if defined, otherwise its name.

db:section.db:title: [static] void QTextCodec::setCodecForLocale(QTextCodec *c)
db:section.db:para: Set the codec to c; this will be returned by codecForLocale(). If c is nullptr, the codec is reset to the default.
This might be needed for some applications that want to use their own mechanism for setting the locale.

db:section.db:title: QString QTextCodec::toUnicode(const QByteArray &a) const
db:section.db:para: Converts a from the encoding of this codec to Unicode, and returns the result in a QString.

db:section.db:title: QString QTextCodec::toUnicode(const char *input, int size, QTextCodec::ConverterState *state = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Converts the first size characters from the input from the encoding of this codec to Unicode, and returns the result in a QString.
The state of the convertor used is updated.

db:section.db:title: QString QTextCodec::toUnicode(const char *chars) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
chars contains the source characters.

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for QTextCodec
db:section.db:para: The following members of class QTextCodec are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: [static, deprecated] QTextCodec *QTextCodec::codecForTr()
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Returns the codec used by QObject::tr() on its argument. If this function returns nullptr (the default), tr() assumes Latin-1.
